newsitem.title: GREECE: GREEK APRIL REGISTERED UNEMPLOYMENT DROPS TO 8.5PCT.
newsitem.headline: GREEK APRIL REGISTERED UNEMPLOYMENT DROPS TO 8.5PCT.

text.p: The Greek registered unemployment rate fell to 8.5 percent in April from 9.2 percent in March and the number of registered unemployed dropped to 210,494 in April from 227,052 in March, central bank figures showed.
The registered unemployment rate is known to underestimate the actual unemployment rate. Actual unemployment figures are published once every year.
The actual unemployment rate stood at 10.4 percent in 1996 and is officially projected to fall to 10.1 percent this year. --Dimitris Kontogiannis, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
